prompt.content:
attached are several prompts I used to create an application (not in sequential, or any, order)., and a packaged version of the app repo is also attached

review the prompts and my repo thoroughly and create both:

(1) a consolidated description of the app, its functionality, etc for me to use as context in future prompts related to improving the app and researching data feed/API integration options;
dkl
(2) draft documentation for my app that provides comprehensive details about its functionality and use for users (and devs).

If you are unsure from the prompts or repo whether the app behaves or functions in a certain way, or allows for something, please provide those questions, associated commentary, and recommendation in callout format following the appropriate section of the docs here are my prompts:

attachedFiles.name: app-prompt-history-1.txt
attachedFiles.contentText:
app-prompt-history-1
-------------------------------------------------------------------------



----------------------------------------------------------

ok we now need to make an important and potentially complicated change:

(1) we need to change the name of the "properties" backend table to "listings".

(2) we need to change anything throughout our entire codebase that references "properties" to reference the updated "listings" name

(3) we need to change all front-end text instances of properties ("properties" or "Properties" or "property" or "Prtoperty") to the cooresponding variant of listings (e.g. "listings", "Listings", "listing", "Listing")

----------------------------------------------------------
----------------------------------------------------------
----------------------------------------------------------

for the mapbox component, switch from a globe projection to a flat map projection to improve usability and visual clarity.. also change the markers to simple small circular dots with dot color corresponding to property status.

limit the map view to the area roughly 20 miles around Washington DC. allow zooming in but not zooming out beyond that area

lastly, add a small popup that appears when clicking a marker that shows the associated address, status, builder, and price

----------------------------------------------------------

the Start Geocoding Batch button is working but only in batches of 10 - we need to maintain the rate-limiting to respect mapbox limits, but the button should continue to run through all properties table records that meet the existing geocoding conditions (missing coordinates but have address_line_1, city, and state column values)

----------------------------------------------------------

i tried the "Geocode Missing Coordinates" button and am getting the following error:

Failed to fetch properties: column properties.street_number does not exist

note: it is true that the preoperties backend table does not have a street_number column. we should only be using the "address_line_1", "city", and "state" columnlumns from the backend properties table. if any record does nnot have compleye information for those columns then omit it from geocoding/mapping

----------------------------------------------------------

ok now, let's implement your recommendation regarding server-side geocoding. is this something where supabase edge functions are appropriate? we want to check all of the records in our backend properties table and geocode any that (1) have "address_line_1", "city", "state" column values, AND (2) are missing "longitude" and "latitude" column values

----------------------------------------------------------

ok now I want to integrate working map components into the app using mapbox

in the Integrations tabs of the Settings page, we need to another container after the "AI Integrations" container called the "Mapbox" where the user can input and save their Mapbox API key, as well as adjust any other Mapbox settings/parameters we expose

Note: we want our default maps component to use very minimal styling - white background with only regional/state/city/county/neighborhood outlines (depending on zoom level) and road lines in grey, and mapped properties shown as circular markers in a reddish orange color

the map component should handle mapping single propeties, subgroups of properties, or all properties in the backend properties table, using only the respective  "address_line_1", "city", and "state" column values

the first place we need to add this maps component is to the lower left side of dashboard page - this instance should display a map of all properties in the backend properties table with status of "Active"  or "Coming Soon"

----------------------------------------------------------

i just tested the import again - it completed succesfully and correctly impacted the properties backend table.

however, the upload history table is still not showing correct values for the new record after it appears following completion of the import processing.

additionally, there was no toast notification or console error

I checked the backend csv_uploads table and it appears the filename and upload_date columns are correct for the newly added record. The other columns are showing no or incorrect values - here is a table of the csv_uploads table columns and what I am seeing for each in the supabase backend:

| filename | working - correct value |
| upload_date | working - correct value |
| records_processed | no value |
| records_created | no value |
| records_updated | no value |
| status | incorrect value "processing" |
| error_log | working - no value expected given import completed successfully with no error |
| metadata | may be working - no value - not sure if we expect any value here |
| records_failed | no value |

Note: the actual import functionality with respect to adding  and/or updating the properties backend table continues to work correctly, so should not be changed. We need to fix the issues directly pertaining to the post-import results reporting in csv_uploads table

----------------------------------------------------------

I am now able to successfully import files with saved field mappings, and upon completion a new record is correctly shown in the "Upload History" table. however, none of the fields associated with the record are being populated (i.e. the Date, Total, New, Updated, Ignored, and Failed fields). Additionally, the "Status" field has a value of "processing" despite the import having completed and without error.

additionally, for this table (Upload HIstory table), make sure
1. none of the text/values in the record rows use bold font weight (use normal font weight)
2. the Total/New/Updated/Ignored/Failed columns have equal width

----------------------------------------------------------

note that we should no longer be using hsl color values since we switched to hex color values - we may be able to drop the hsl color value columsn from the user_settings table

----------------------------------------------------------

the field mappings saved from the sheet component in the import data page should be reflected in the data structure tab of the settings page after clicking the save button (on import data page sheet component)

currently this is not working

----------------------------------------------------------

we need to save users' upload field mappings so they do not have to map fields they have already mapped and saved.

create a new tab in the settings page after the "Integrations" tab named "Data Structure". in this tab there should be a dropdown select to choose either the "properties" or "builders" backend table -> upon selecting one, all column names from the corresponding table should be loaded as a vertical list. to the right of each column name we need a pill input box containing (1) previously saved mappings are shown, and (2) the user can start typing a new field name to map, which converts to a pill upon hitting enter.

then when the user adds a file to upload in the import page, the Map Fields sheet component should pre-map any field that is present in the saved list of fields that map to a given backend table column (if more than one upload file field map to the same backend table column, only allow one to be set and disable the others that map to the same backend table column)

Note: if you need to make backend changes, make them directly in supabase. also  do not change anything across the rest of the app. do not change the settings page tabs.

----------------------------------------------------------

we need to improve the speed of the import/upload processing - currently it is too slow

additionally we also need to add some post-upload processing of specific properties table columns - e.g. the subdivision column values need to be converted to Title Case, and the status column values need to be mapped to the corresponding valeus in this table:

| A/C 	|   Active Under Contract |
| ACT	|   Active |
| C/S 	| 	Coming Soon |
| CLS 	| 	Closed |
| CNL	| 	Canceled |
| PND	| 	Pending |
| T/O	| 	Temporary Off Market |
| WTH	| 	Withdrawn |
| EXP	| 	Expired |
additionally, for the import functionality, we need to add a toggle next to the "Map Fields" button giving the user the option to "Override Existing Values" - if turned on, existing column values for records in the upload file that already existing in the backend proeprties table (based on MLS ID) will be replaced by the upload file values

lastly, for the upload history table in the Import Data page, limit the visible rows to 5 and paginate the rest

----------------------------------------------------------

ok now we need to clean up the backend  properties table. we need to remove the following columns completely:

```
  category,
  agreement_date,
  street_number,
  street_direction,
  street_name,
  unit_number,
  mls_area,
  list_agent_code,
  list_office_code,
  list_office_phone,
  selling_agent,
  selling_agent_code,
  selling_office_name,
  selling_office_code,
  selling_office_phone,
  final_financing,
  final_short_sale,
  final_third_party_approval,
  final_bank_owned,
  tax_annual_total,
  tax_year,
  ownership,
  senior_community,
  condo_coop_assoc,
  one_time_association_fee,
  association_fee,
  age,
  interior_sqft,
  design,
  number_of_stories,
  floor_number,
  laundry,
  other_rooms,
  room_count,
  central_air,
  waterfront,
  originating_mls,
  above_grade_sqft,
  below_grade_sqft,
  home_built,
  basement_footprint_pct,
  basement_finished_pct,
  development_status
```
for the import functionality, please make sure that "MLS #"  in import files is auto-mapped to mls_number (our properties table mls id)

additionally, on the import page, we need to add:
1. additional pre-processing information when a file is added - specifically, the number of records in the file, the number of new records (new MLS ID) in the file, the number of matched records (where MLS ID is alreadh in properties table), the total number of column/fields in file, the number of fields from file auto-matched to properties table columns, and the number of fields from file that were not auto-matched to any properties table fields
2. a table below the "Import Property Data" component containing upload history including the post-processing results for each

----------------------------------------------------------

now we need to improve the import functionality.

we need to move the "Start Import" button to the right side  of its container, and add a "Map Fields" button in the Start Import button's current place.

after a file has been added, clicking the "map fields" button will trigger a shadcn "Sheet" component to open from the right - this will contain a vertical list of all fields from the csv file - next to each field will be a dropdown to select the corresponding backend proeprties table field.

additionally, we need to add a "plus" icon button to create additional database fields

after the user has finished adjusting the field mappings, they can click the Done/Save button at the bottom of the Sheet component, which saves the configuration and closes the component. The user can then click the Start Import button, initiating the processing using the user's mapping configuration

----------------------------------------------------------
https://ttrsir.okta.com/oauth2/v1/authorize?client_id=okta.2b1959c8-bcc0-56eb-a589-cfcfb7422f26&code_challenge=5BBrzfABgsIoz0c3GuhUestxhPlhNx0biSolMKXPN-4&code_challenge_method=S256&nonce=15UGRvRT5iqSIgHa1ho5R8Da93coytBCpCACWIupnAzMcQDgnvtLwMCbFKNFwJXR&redirect_uri=https%3A%2F%2Fttrsir.okta.com%2Fenduser%2Fcallback&response_type=code&state=5HnQMqUeBFHParuiauCRxnZ4QYihUoCUioYnztVNaA4jnooqWKziW0obPwyGi31X&scope=openid%20profile%20email%20okta.users.read.self%20okta.users.manage.self%20okta.internal.enduser.read%20okta.internal.enduser.manage%20okta.enduser.dashboard.read%20okta.enduser.dashboard.manage%20okta.myAccount.sessions.manage

----------------------------------------------------------

it seems we are still experiencing the user_id error, as well as a couple others

one of the others may be due to the fact that there are 2 fields related to "New Construction..." - one is "New Construction" and the other is "New Construction YN". the "New Construction YN" column should be handled fine as its only possible values are yes or no. However the "New Construction" column includes more information: it provides the yes or no as well as completion status if the first part of the stirng is yes. we want this information in the backend properties table, so may just have to map it to a new column

----------------------------------------------------------

now, for the social post objects - we need to modify so the user can specify (1) the content type of the social post object ("Single Property" or "Multi Property" and (2) the format type of the social post object (Carousel, Post, Reel, Story)

the user should be able to edit both of these from the social post object details view page, and should be prompted to choose each when creating a new social post object

additionally,, for the social post details view page, change the default of the associated property containers to expanded (currently collapsed)

lastly, we need to integrate AI features in multiple places - for now, we want to add an icon button under the "Description" input box for  each associated property in the social post details view page - clicking this button should present a popover menu with a couple options ("Rewrite", "Prompt"). Choosing prompt will present a larger input popup for the user to type a prompt and a button to submit, the output response will then be inserted into the description box; the rewrite option will rewrite the content that already exists in the description box.

for the AI integration, we need to use the OpenAI API - to enable the AI, the user must  navigate to the settings page, where a new tab titled "Integrations" will display an input box where they can input and save their own API key, as well as select from a dropdown list of available OpenAI models. these should be added to the user's settings in the backend

----------------------------------------------------------

for the style guide, change the HSL color inputs to HEX code color inputs instead.  additionally, add more of our components and their variants, like tables/data tables, modals, popovers, toast notifications , dropdown menus, multi-select and select, checkboxes and radios, cards, dialogs/alert dialogs, switches, toggles, buttons with icons, button groups, and comboboxes,

additionally, for the Import Data page:
- add a drag & drop area and style the elements on page more like the attached screenshot.
- add another container that shows results of data upload after processing, include breakdown of new records successfully added, records updated (i.e. where null/missing data fields were provided), and ignored/duplicate records; also include count of records that failed to upload due to error

lastly, check the "Create Post" button on the Social Posts page - it is still not working (not creating new social post object and no notifications/communication provided)

----------------------------------------------------------

now the "Create Post" button on the social psots page is not working again - please fix it.

additionally, for the "Progress" value for each social post object - make the progress % based on the aggregate tasks completed as % of aggregate total tasks (aggregated of child properties of the social post object)

lastly, for the social posts table on the Social posts page, make the expanded sub-rows background color the same as the parent/collapsed rows, and replace the MLS ID with the address value (remove the 

----------------------------------------------------------

https://apps.oag.state.md.us/hb_uploads/

----------------------------------------------------------

in the Post Details view page, seperate out the post name and make it editable (should update backend upon changing). also seperate the description and make it editable. show the status as a badge.

change the "Assoicated Properties" Title to just "Properties", move it outside/above the container and make it smaller like a tagline/eyebrow format.

then for each record associate dproperty record,  add a very small header above the MLS label/value and set that header's text to the Address of the property.. remove the bold format for the Price and Status labels

move thecheckboxes to the horizontal middle of the record container and position the checkbox labels above the checkboxes and set font color to more muted/grey

additionally make each record expandable - when expanded, everything visible in the collapsed view remains unchanged with no height change. the expanded area displays an text input box with label Description, which uses ~60% of the available width; the remaining width  contains the image or images set by user for the property specifically for this social post object - if multiple images, shrink them to fit as equal size thumbnails. there should be a plus button to add additional photos via upload, as well as the ability to remove images by clicking a small "X" button that appears in the top right of each thumbnail when hovered

note: uploaded images should be added to a new storage bucket in supabase, and removed upon deletion

also, make the view pages style more like the style in this attached screenshot

----------------------------------------------------------

now, instead of displaying an additional container for the new post (which I currently see as "New Post 1 - Properties" after having created a new post named "New Post 1"),  make the post objects table rows expandable/toggleable so that when a row is expanded, each associated property is displayed as a subrow w the fields Status, Builder, Price, and Address display across the sub-row, and the 3 checkbox elements on the far right/end of the sub-row.

additionally add labels of "Contacted", "Image", "Description" for the  three checkboxes using very small font size and muted/neutral font color; also make the checkbox checked state color a blueish green instead of the current black. also make the checkbox border radius slightly rounded (only a bit). For the social posts table, seperate out the "Mark Posted" button (that appears when progress value is 100%) in a new columnn and use the same blueish green color instead of the current black background; also make the progress bar accent color use the blueish green color when it has reached 100%.

also for the Social Posts table, the user needs the ability to select rows and perform actions like "Complete All" or "Delete". Note that deleting posts does not delete the underlying property lsiting records, only the social post object

Lastly, each social post object in the table should have an "Open" button on the far right of each row - this button needs to open a Post Details view page

----------------------------------------------------------

the "Create Post" button is still not working - clicking it while properties are selected does not do anything and I do not see any errors logged in the console. please make sure it is fixed and functional, with the social post object being created in backend and toast notifications communicating processing state, error, or success

the button is still not working/doing anything - and i see no toast notifications or error logging indicating an issue. please fix and make sure that when the object is created in backend it is then visible in the "Social Posts" table as well

----------------------------------------------------------

the assign builder functionality must present a popup list of builders with search ability and await the user's selection and confirmation of the selected builder before assigning a builder to the property record(s)

additionally, the properties table on the properties page should have a column showing the builder associated with each property. NOTE: some properties may not have an associated builder if one was not automatically identified or manually set.

the edit button does not work in the property details page view and edit button does not work in the builder details page view

in the builder details view page, add a column chart that displays the builder's listings over time (3 month, 6 month, 1 yr, 3 yr. 5 yr, all) with the y-axis/column height value being the sale/listing price. Also, add a data table component to the builder detail view page with all associated listings, including all relevant columns. Lastly, add a small, minimal map component that displays small circular markers (using color #c22f47) for their associated property listings. the map  can be integrated later but will be very minimal in style (white background only showing regional/county/neighborhood outlines and prominent roads using grey line colors)

----------------------------------------------------------

the import functionality seems ot be working now, however there does not seem to be anything preventing duplicate records from being created - use the MLS ID in the upload as an additional unique ID check in order to prevent creating listing records for which a record with the same MLS ID already exists in the backend table

the add new builder button and the add new property buttons do not work

I cannot open the builder profile page for any of the builders listed in the Builders page - there should be a Builder details page view for each builder, showing all info for the builder as well as their past builds found in the listings backend table

additionally, in the properties page  table and the property details view page, the user needs to be able to update the Builder assoicated with the listing record (individually and in bulk via the table) --- update the listings backend table schema if necessary to add a field for builder ID associated with each record - i.e. connecting to the builders backend table

the Analytics & Reports pages do not seem to exist

----------------------------------------------------------

the import functionality does not seem to be working - the Import button is stuck on a loading state after clicking

the add new builder button and the add enw property buttons do not work

I cannot open the builder profile page for any of the builders listed in the Builders page

the Analytics & Reports pages do not seem to exist

on the properties page, the Export button does not work and the Filters button does not do anything. additionally, I cannot open the details page for any of the properties in the table. also, we need to make the properties in the table selectable with the ability to perform bulk actions - like "Hide", "Add Tag", and "Add to Social Qeue"

lastly, we must add another tool/page to the app - the tool is called "Social Posts" - which presents a table of properties the user has added to the "Social post pipeline" . the user should be able to add new properties and delete existing properties from the qeue on this page (individual and in bulk). Additionally the user must be able to select properties and mark/add them to a new or existing "Post" object. Lastly,the user must be able to change the status of multiple fields/columns for each property via the table - e.g. mark "image", "description", "contacted" as complete.

another table on this new tool page with contain all past (posted) and current (incomplete and/or complete but not posted) social post objects. Current post objects will show a progress bar with progress calculated as the % of child properties marked as complete. Once the final property is marked as complete for a given social post object, the user should be prompted whether they would like to mark the social object as "Posted" - if they confirm, they must provide a link to the post (an instagram link) in order for the "Posted" status to be assigned. Otherwise, the social post object will show as completed but will not have a check-mark "Posted" badge in the status column. Posted object rows will display a button to open the associated post link.

----------------------------------------------------------

i am creating a highly tailored micro-application for a real estate agent who specializes in luxury residential new construction in the DC/MD/VA region. the aim of the micro-app is to provide:

(1) a view of the current state of the local new construction market and builder activity

	- (all listings identified as new construction or associated with a builder that are currently active, coming soon, or other desired statuses selected by user, as well as properties that have no current listing/status of any kind across feeds but have been identified as builder-owned based on either (a) last sale data from historical transaction database or (b) manual tag) insights on, the local new construction market trends and current status

----------------------------------------------------------

create an exactly identical clone of Attio's web app, with fully functional backend implemented using Supabase, but tailored for a real estate agent specializing in luxury residential new construction in the DC/MD/VA region. instead of a CRM-style focus on contacts, the app must focus on the local new residential construction market - frontend features tools, insights/trends, and current view of state of the market using database table of listing data (current and historical) and database table of local builders (with extensive information/data profiles for each). one view should show a data table/spreadsheet style view of all current (and coming soon) listings identified as new construction, as well as all properties with no current listing status but which have been identified as in development/construction phase (based on last sale metadata or manually added tag). for now, use the attached csv to seed the backend/use as initial data set - include page and implement functionality for manual data updates (via subsequent csv uploads by user). third party real estate data feeds/APIs will be integrated later, and potentially enrichment APIs for more complete builder profiles. 

----------------------------------------------------------

create an exactly identical clone of Attio's web app using NextJS, with fully functional backend implemented using Supabase, but tailored for a real estate agent specializing in luxury residential new construction in the DC/MD/VA region. instead of a CRM-style focus on contacts, the app must focus on the local new residential construction market - frontend features tools, insights/trends, and current view of state of the market using database table of listing data (current and historical) and database table of local builders (with extensive information/data profiles for each). one view should show a data table/spreadsheet style view of all current (and coming soon) listings identified as new construction, as well as all properties with no current listing status but which have been identified as in development/construction phase (based on last sale metadata or manually added tag). for now, use the attached csv to seed the backend/use as initial data set - include page and implement functionality for manual data updates (via subsequent csv uploads by user). third party real estate data feeds/APIs will be integrated later, and potentially enrichment APIs for more complete builder profiles.

also include auth, user management, user settings, etc

NOTE: do not approach design decisions from a marketing or customer-facing product perspective - this is INTERNAL TOOLING. it should be identical to Attio's design system, or similar to Vercel's web app interface components - largely white with very dense/compact layouts. aim to reduce empty/unused/white-space throughout the interface and use smaller than normal font sizes

----------------------------------------------------------

This file is a merged representation of the entire codebase, combined into a single document by Repomix. The content has been processed where security check has been disabled. # File Summary ## Purpose This file contains a packed representation of the entire repository's contents. It is designed to be easily consumable by AI systems for analysis, code review, or other automated processes. ## File Format The content is organized as follows: 1. This summary section 2. Repository information 3. Directory structure 4. Repository files (if enabled) 5. Multiple file entries, each consisting of: a. A header with the file path (## File: path/to/file) b. The full contents of the file in a code block ## Usage Guidelines - This file should be treated as read-only. Any changes should be made to the original repository files, not this packed version. - When processing this file, use the file path to distinguish between different files in the repository. - Be aware that this file may contain sensitive information. Handle it with the same level of security as you would the original repository. ## Notes - Some files may have been excluded based on .gitignore rules and Repomix's configuration - Binary files are not included in this packed representation. attachedFiles.name: app-prompt-history-1.txt
attachedFiles.contentText:
app-prompt-history-1
-------------------------------------------------------------------------



----------------------------------------------------------

ok we now need to make an important and potentially complicated change:

(1) we need to change the name of the "properties" backend table to "listings".

(2) we need to change anything throughout our entire codebase that references "properties" to reference the updated "listings" name

(3) we need to change all front-end text instances of properties ("properties" or "Properties" or "property" or "Prtoperty") to the cooresponding variant of listings (e.g. "listings", "Listings", "listing", "Listing")

----------------------------------------------------------
----------------------------------------------------------
----------------------------------------------------------

for the mapbox component, switch from a globe projection to a flat map projection to improve usability and visual clarity.. also change the markers to simple small circular dots with dot color corresponding to property status.

limit the map view to the area roughly 20 miles around Washington DC. allow zooming in but not zooming out beyond that area

lastly, add a small popup that appears when clicking a marker that shows the associated address, status, builder, and price

----------------------------------------------------------

the Start Geocoding Batch button is working but only in batches of 10 - we need to maintain the rate-limiting to respect mapbox limits, but the button should continue to run through all properties table records that meet the existing geocoding conditions (missing coordinates but have address_line_1, city, and state column values)

----------------------------------------------------------

i tried the "Geocode Missing Coordinates" button and am getting the following error:

Failed to fetch properties: column properties.street_number does not exist

note: it is true that the preoperties backend table does not have a street_number column. we should only be using the "address_line_1", "city", and "state" columnlumns from the backend properties table. if any record does nnot have compleye information for those columns then omit it from geocoding/mapping

----------------------------------------------------------

ok now, let's implement your recommendation regarding server-side geocoding. is this something where supabase edge functions are appropriate? we want to check all of the records in our backend properties table and geocode any that (1) have "address_line_1", "city", "state" column values, AND (2) are missing "longitude" and "latitude" column values

----------------------------------------------------------

ok now I want to integrate working map components into the app using mapbox

in the Integrations tabs of the Settings page, we need to another container after the "AI Integrations" container called the "Mapbox" where the user can input and save their Mapbox API key, as well as adjust any other Mapbox settings/parameters we expose

Note: we want our default maps component to use very minimal styling - white background with only regional/state/city/county/neighborhood outlines (depending on zoom level) and road lines in grey, and mapped properties shown as circular markers in a reddish orange color

the map component should handle mapping single propeties, subgroups of properties, or all properties in the backend properties table, using only the respective  "address_line_1", "city", and "state" column values

the first place we need to add this maps component is to the lower left side of dashboard page - this instance should display a map of all properties in the backend properties table with status of "Active"  or "Coming Soon"

----------------------------------------------------------

i just tested the import again - it completed succesfully and correctly impacted the properties backend table.

however, the upload history table is still not showing correct values for the new record after it appears following completion of the import processing.

additionally, there was no toast notification or console error

I checked the backend csv_uploads table and it appears the filename and upload_date columns are correct for the newly added record. The other columns are showing no or incorrect values - here is a table of the csv_uploads table columns and what I am seeing for each in the supabase backend:

| filename | working - correct value |
| upload_date | working - correct value |
| records_processed | no value |
| records_created | no value |
| records_updated | no value |
| status | incorrect value "processing" |
| error_log | working - no value expected given import completed successfully with no error |
| metadata | may be working - no value - not sure if we expect any value here |
| records_failed | no value |

Note: the actual import functionality with respect to adding  and/or updating the properties backend table continues to work correctly, so should not be changed. We need to fix the issues directly pertaining to the post-import results reporting in csv_uploads table

----------------------------------------------------------

I am now able to successfully import files with saved field mappings, and upon completion a new record is correctly shown in the "Upload History" table. however, none of the fields associated with the record are being populated (i.e. the Date, Total, New, Updated, Ignored, and Failed fields). Additionally, the "Status" field has a value of "processing" despite the import having completed and without error.

additionally, for this table (Upload HIstory table), make sure
1. none of the text/values in the record rows use bold font weight (use normal font weight)
2. the Total/New/Updated/Ignored/Failed columns have equal width

----------------------------------------------------------

note that we should no longer be using hsl color values since we switched to hex color values - we may be able to drop the hsl color value columsn from the user_settings table

----------------------------------------------------------

the field mappings saved from the sheet component in the import data page should be reflected in the data structure tab of the settings page after clicking the save button (on import data page sheet component)

currently this is not working

----------------------------------------------------------

we need to save users' upload field mappings so they do not have to map fields they have already mapped and saved.

create a new tab in the settings page after the "Integrations" tab named "Data Structure". in this tab there should be a dropdown select to choose either the "properties" or "builders" backend table -> upon selecting one, all column names from the corresponding table should be loaded as a vertical list. to the right of each column name we need a pill input box containing (1) previously saved mappings are shown, and (2) the user can start typing a new field name to map, which converts to a pill upon hitting enter.

then when the user adds a file to upload in the import page, the Map Fields sheet component should pre-map any field that is present in the saved list of fields that map to a given backend table column (if more than one upload file field map to the same backend table column, only allow one to be set and disable the others that map to the same backend table column)

Note: if you need to make backend changes, make them directly in supabase. also  do not change anything across the rest of the app. do not change the settings page tabs.

----------------------------------------------------------

we need to improve the speed of the import/upload processing - currently it is too slow

additionally we also need to add some post-upload processing of specific properties table columns - e.g. the subdivision column values need to be converted to Title Case, and the status column values need to be mapped to the corresponding valeus in this table:

| A/C 	|   Active Under Contract |
| ACT	|   Active |
| C/S 	| 	Coming Soon |
| CLS 	| 	Closed |
| CNL	| 	Canceled |
| PND	| 	Pending |
| T/O	| 	Temporary Off Market |
| WTH	| 	Withdrawn |
| EXP	| 	Expired |
additionally, for the import functionality, we need to add a toggle next to the "Map Fields" button giving the user the option to "Override Existing Values" - if turned on, existing column values for records in the upload file that already existing in the backend proeprties table (based on MLS ID) will be replaced by the upload file values

lastly, for the upload history table in the Import Data page, limit the visible rows to 5 and paginate the rest

----------------------------------------------------------

ok now we need to clean up the backend  properties table. we need to remove the following columns completely:

```
  category,
  agreement_date,
  street_number,
  street_direction,
  street_name,
  unit_number,
  mls_area,
  list_agent_code,
  list_office_code,
  list_office_phone,
  selling_agent,
  selling_agent_code,
  selling_office_name,
  selling_office_code,
  selling_office_phone,
  final_financing,
  final_short_sale,
  final_third_party_approval,
  final_bank_owned,
  tax_annual_total,
  tax_year,
  ownership,
  senior_community,
  condo_coop_assoc,
  one_time_association_fee,
  association_fee,
  age,
  interior_sqft,
  design,
  number_of_stories,
  floor_number,
  laundry,
  other_rooms,
  room_count,
  central_air,
  waterfront,
  originating_mls,
  above_grade_sqft,
  below_grade_sqft,
  home_built,
  basement_footprint_pct,
  basement_finished_pct,
  development_status
```
for the import functionality, please make sure that "MLS #"  in import files is auto-mapped to mls_number (our properties table mls id)

additionally, on the import page, we need to add:
1. additional pre-processing information when a file is added - specifically, the number of records in the file, the number of new records (new MLS ID) in the file, the number of matched records (where MLS ID is alreadh in properties table), the total number of column/fields in file, the number of fields from file auto-matched to properties table columns, and the number of fields from file that were not auto-matched to any properties table fields
2. a table below the "Import Property Data" component containing upload history including the post-processing results for each

----------------------------------------------------------

now we need to improve the import functionality.

we need to move the "Start Import" button to the right side  of its container, and add a "Map Fields" button in the Start Import button's current place.

after a file has been added, clicking the "map fields" button will trigger a shadcn "Sheet" component to open from the right - this will contain a vertical list of all fields from the csv file - next to each field will be a dropdown to select the corresponding backend proeprties table field.

additionally, we need to add a "plus" icon button to create additional database fields

after the user has finished adjusting the field mappings, they can click the Done/Save button at the bottom of the Sheet component, which saves the configuration and closes the component. The user can then click the Start Import button, initiating the processing using the user's mapping configuration

----------------------------------------------------------
https://ttrsir.okta.com/oauth2/v1/authorize?client_id=okta.2b1959c8-bcc0-56eb-a589-cfcfb7422f26&code_challenge=5BBrzfABgsIoz0c3GuhUestxhPlhNx0biSolMKXPN-4&code_challenge_method=S256&nonce=15UGRvRT5iqSIgHa1ho5R8Da93coytBCpCACWIupnAzMcQDgnvtLwMCbFKNFwJXR&redirect_uri=https%3A%2F%2Fttrsir.okta.com%2Fenduser%2Fcallback&response_type=code&state=5HnQMqUeBFHParuiauCRxnZ4QYihUoCUioYnztVNaA4jnooqWKziW0obPwyGi31X&scope=openid%20profile%20email%20okta.users.read.self%20okta.users.manage.self%20okta.internal.enduser.read%20okta.internal.enduser.manage%20okta.enduser.dashboard.read%20okta.enduser.dashboard.manage%20okta.myAccount.sessions.manage

----------------------------------------------------------

it seems we are still experiencing the user_id error, as well as a couple others

one of the others may be due to the fact that there are 2 fields related to "New Construction..." - one is "New Construction" and the other is "New Construction YN". the "New Construction YN" column should be handled fine as its only possible values are yes or no. However the "New Construction" column includes more information: it provides the yes or no as well as completion status if the first part of the stirng is yes. we want this information in the backend properties table, so may just have to map it to a new column

----------------------------------------------------------

now, for the social post objects - we need to modify so the user can specify (1) the content type of the social post object ("Single Property" or "Multi Property" and (2) the format type of the social post object (Carousel, Post, Reel, Story)

the user should be able to edit both of these from the social post object details view page, and should be prompted to choose each when creating a new social post object

additionally,, for the social post details view page, change the default of the associated property containers to expanded (currently collapsed)

lastly, we need to integrate AI features in multiple places - for now, we want to add an icon button under the "Description" input box for  each associated property in the social post details view page - clicking this button should present a popover menu with a couple options ("Rewrite", "Prompt"). Choosing prompt will present a larger input popup for the user to type a prompt and a button to submit, the output response will then be inserted into the description box; the rewrite option will rewrite the content that already exists in the description box.

for the AI integration, we need to use the OpenAI API - to enable the AI, the user must  navigate to the settings page, where a new tab titled "Integrations" will display an input box where they can input and save their own API key, as well as select from a dropdown list of available OpenAI models. these should be added to the user's settings in the backend

----------------------------------------------------------

for the style guide, change the HSL color inputs to HEX code color inputs instead.  additionally, add more of our components and their variants, like tables/data tables, modals, popovers, toast notifications , dropdown menus, multi-select and select, checkboxes and radios, cards, dialogs/alert dialogs, switches, toggles, buttons with icons, button groups, and comboboxes,

additionally, for the Import Data page:
- add a drag & drop area and style the elements on page more like the attached screenshot.
- add another container that shows results of data upload after processing, include breakdown of new records successfully added, records updated (i.e. where null/missing data fields were provided), and ignored/duplicate records; also include count of records that failed to upload due to error

lastly, check the "Create Post" button on the Social Posts page - it is still not working (not creating new social post object and no notifications/communication provided)

----------------------------------------------------------

i am creating a highly tailored micro-application for a real estate agent who specializes in luxury residential new construction in the DC/MD/VA region. the aim of the micro-app is to provide:

(1) a view of the current state of the local new construction market and builder activity

	- (all listings identified as new construction or associated with a builder that are currently active, coming soon, or other desired statuses selected by user, as well as properties that have no current listing/status of any kind across feeds but have been identified as builder-owned based on either (a) last sale data from historical transaction database or (b) manual tag) insights on, the local new construction market trends and current status

----------------------------------------------------------

create an exactly identical clone of Attio's web app, with fully functional backend implemented using Supabase, but tailored for a real estate agent specializing in luxury residential new construction in the DC/MD/VA region. instead of a CRM-style focus on contacts, the app must focus on the local new residential construction market - frontend features tools, insights/trends, and current view of state of the market using database table of listing data (current and historical) and database table of local builders (with extensive information/data profiles for each). one view should show a data table/spreadsheet style view of all current (and coming soon) listings identified as new construction, as well as all properties with no current listing status but which have been identified as in development/construction phase (based on last sale metadata or manually added tag). for now, use the attached csv to seed the backend/use as initial data set - include page and implement functionality for manual data updates (via subsequent csv uploads by user). third party real estate data feeds/APIs will be integrated later, and potentially enrichment APIs for more complete builder profiles.

create an exactly identical clone of Attio's web app using NextJS, with fully functional backend implemented using Supabase, but tailored for a real estate agent specializing in luxury residential new construction in the DC/MD/VA region. instead of a CRM-style focus on contacts, the app must focus on the local new residential construction market - frontend features tools, insights/trends, and current view of state of the market using database table of listing data (current and historical) and database table of local builders (with extensive information/data profiles for each). one view should show a data table/spreadsheet style view of all current (and coming soon) listings identified as new construction, as well as all properties with no current listing status but which have been identified as in development/construction phase (based on last sale metadata or manually added tag). for now, use the attached csv to seed the backend/use as initial data set - include page and implement functionality for manual data updates (via subsequent csv uploads by user). third party real estate data feeds/APIs will be integrated later, and potentially enrichment APIs for more complete builder profiles.

also include auth, user management, user settings, etc

NOTE: do not approach design decisions from a marketing or customer-facing product perspective - this is INTERNAL TOOLING. it should be identical to Attio's design system, or similar to Vercel's web app interface components - largely white with very dense/compact layouts. aim to reduce empty/unused/white-space throughout the interface and use smaller than normal font sizes

prompt.content:
attached are several prompts I used to create an application (not in sequential, or any, order)., and a packaged version of the app repo is also attached

review the prompts and my repo thoroughly and create both:

(1) a consolidated description of the app, its functionality, etc for me to use as context in future prompts related to improving the app and researching data feed/API integration options;
dkl
(2) draft documentation for my app that provides comprehensive details about its functionality and use for users (and devs).

If you are unsure from the prompts or repo whether the app behaves or functions in a certain way, or allows for something, please provide those questions, associated commentary, and recommendation in callout format following the appropriate section of the docs here are my prompts:

interactions.response:
====================================================================
1.  CONDENSED SOURCE-OF-TRUTH DESCRIPTION
====================================================================

The application is an internal, web-based micro-platform (Next .js 14 app router + TypeScript) for a luxury-new-construction real-estate practice operating in Washington DC / Maryland / Virginia.  
It replaces the CRM-style focus of Attio with data & workflow tooling around:

 Listings  every residential property identified as new-construction or builder-owned, current or historical.  
 Builders  company profiles for regional builders and their activity.  
 Market Intelligence  dashboards, analytics & map visualisations.  
 Social-Media Production  workflow to queue listings, mark task check-boxes (image / description / contacted), generate copy with OpenAI, and track post objects & progress.  
 Bulk Data Import  CSV upload with intelligent field-mapping, deduplication via MLS#, upsert vs override logic, per-user saved mappings, upload history & error reporting.  
 User Settings & Integrations  user-scoped OpenAI & Mapbox keys, accent colour picker (HEX), RLS-protected preferences.  
 Server-Side Utilities  a Supabase Edge Function that geocodes missing listing coordinates in rate-limited batches using Mapbox.  
 Authentication  Supabase Auth (email+password).  
 Compact, Attio-style UI  ShadCN + Tailwind with dense font-sizes, minimal colour, and custom primary colour per-user.  

High-level structure
--------------------
Next .js  app/ route groups:

(auth)   login / signup / register  
(dashboard)  many pages:
 dashboard (stats + map)  
 listings (DataTable, bulk actions, listing form dialog)  
 builders (DataTable, builder form dialog, builder detail page)  
 social (posts & queue table, detail page)  
 analytics, insights, reports, import, settings, etc.

State & data
------------
Supabase PostgreSQL with RLS.  Key tables:

listings, builders, social_posts, social_post_properties, csv_uploads, user_settings, user_field_mappings.

Frontend state handled with local component state + React Table selection; AuthContext provides session & user.

Integrations
------------
 Mapbox GL JS for maps (minimal grey-line style, builder/listing dots, popups).  
 OpenAI (via AI SDK) for copy generation (rewrite / prompt)  user supplies own API key.  
 Edge function geocode-properties for batch geocoding.

Workflow Highlights
-------------------
1. User uploads CSV  dropzone reads headers, auto-maps via rules & user-saved prefs  Sheet component lets user override mapping  optional Override Existing Values toggle  Start Import  server-side chunk loop, dedupe by MLS#, upsert records, stats recorded in csv_uploads  history table paginates 5 rows/page.  
2. Builders & Listings can be created/edited via dialogs; listings reference builder_id.  
3. Social workflow: select listings in Social Posts page  Create Post dialog chooses content_type & format_type and associates listings  each post row shows progress (checkbox triad across child listings) & can be opened  detail page lets user edit title/description, AI tools, upload images (Supabase Storage), set checkmarks.  
4. Dashboard: mini stats + Map (restricted to 20 mi DC bbox, flat projection, small coloured dots, popup with address/status/builder/price).  
5. Analytics: charts (Recharts) for price distribution, top markets, builder performance, etc.  
6. Settings: Preferences (theme, density), Account (password), Notifications, Style Guide (accent colour HEX + component previews), Integrations (OpenAI, Mapbox, geocode batch button), Data Structure (saved field mappings form with PillInput).

====================================================================
2.  DRAFT DOCUMENTATION
====================================================================

NOTEAll sections marked with  contain open questions or recommended clarifications.

------------------------------------------------------------
TABLE OF CONTENTS
------------------------------------------------------------
1.  Getting Started (Users)  
2.  Functional Tour  
2.1  Authentication & Session Behaviour  
2.2  Dashboard  
2.3  Listings Module  
2.4  Builders Module  
2.5  Social Posts Workflow  
2.6  Import Data  
2.7  Analytics, Insights, Reports  
2.8  Settings & Integrations  
3.  Data Model & RLS  
4.  Developer Guide  
4.1  Tech Stack & Project Layout  
4.2  Environment Variables  
4.3  Supabase Schema & Migrations  
4.4  Edge Functions  
4.5  Running Locally  
5.  Maintenance & FAQ  
6.  Road-map / Known Issues

------------------------------------------------------------
1.  GETTING STARTED (END-USERS)
------------------------------------------------------------
1.  Visit /signup to create an account.  
2.  Confirm email, then sign in at /login.  
3.  Go to Settings  Integrations and paste:  
 OpenAI API key (for AI writing)  
 Mapbox public token (for map widgets)  
4.  (Optional) pick a brand accent colour under Style Guide; it will apply after refresh.  
5.  Import your first CSV at Import Data:  
 Drag-and-drop file  
 Review auto-mapping summary  
 Adjust mapping via Map Fields  
 Toggle Override Existing Values if you want incoming non-null cells to overwrite existing ones.  
 Click Start Import and wait for toast confirmation.  
6.  Navigate:  
 Listings  spreadsheet of all records.  
 Builders  company profiles.  
 Dashboard  high-level KPIs + map.  
 Social Posts  manage marketing workflow.

------------------------------------------------------------
2.  FUNCTIONAL TOUR
------------------------------------------------------------

2.1  Authentication & Session  
 Email / Password via Supabase Auth.  
 AuthContext auto-redirects unauth users to /login.  
 Sessions persisted in cookies; RLS guarantees row-level isolation of user_settings, social posts, csv_uploads, field mappings.

2.2  Dashboard  
 Stat cards: total listings, active, new-construction, under-construction, avg list price, total builders.  
 Map (Active & Coming Soon): flat map, 20-mi DC bounds, dot colour by status, popup shows address / status / builder / price.  
 Right column: Recent Activity snapshot & Market Trends (static placeholders).

2.3  Listings  
 DataTable with server data (listings + builder join).  
 Column actions: sort, hide, filter.  
 Bulk actions drawer (Add to Social Queue, Assign Builder, Hide, Delete).  
 Per-row menu: view, edit in dialog, add to social queue.  
 New Listing dialog.  
 Export  CSV.

2.4  Builders  
 DataTable similar to listings.  
 Card view grid.  
 New / Edit dialogs.  
 Builder detail page: contact info, stats, finance, specialties, price-over-time bar chart (time-range selector), listing table, placeholder map.  
 Edit listing builder assignment via Listings page or Assign Builder dialog.

2.5  Social Posts  
 Top table: all post objects (columns: title, status badge, content_type, format_type, listings count, progress bar, Mark Posted button, Actions).  
 Row expand reveals child listings subrows with address, status, builder, price, 3 checkboxes (Contacted, Image, Description)  labels above, checkboxes coloured teal (#14b8a6).  
 Create Post dialog: pick name, content_type, format_type, choose listings (available list filtered to those not already linked in user posts).  
 Post detail page: editable title + description (inline), content/format dropdowns, status badge; accordion of property cards default-expanded.  
 Property card: editable description, AI Wand menu (Rewrite / Prompt), image upload to Supabase Storage (small thumbnails with delete X), checkbox triad with db update.

2.6  Import Data  
 Drag-drop zone styled (dashed).  
 Pre-processing stats panel (records, new vs matched MLS, columns, auto-mapped count, unmatched).  
 Map Fields sheet: left column CSV header, right dropdown to DB column or Ignore. Duplicate DB target detection.  
 Saves personal mappings to user_field_mappings.  
 Start Import  progress bar, toast updates.  
 Backend: chunk size 200, dedupe by mls_number, upsert listings, optional overrideExisting logic, stats persisted in csv_uploads.  
 History table (5 rows/page) with totals, new, updated, ignored (metadata.ignored_records), failed, status badge.

2.7  Analytics, Insights, Reports  
Analytics: price pie, top-market bar, top-builder list, metric cards.  
Insights: high-level cards, price range bars, distribution list.  
Reports: placeholders for PDF/CSV report download buttons.

2.8  Settings  
Tabs: Preferences, Account, Notifications, Style Guide (palette & component playground), Integrations (OpenAI, Mapbox, Start Full Geocoding Process button), Data Structure (table selector + pill inputs for saved field mappings).

------------------------------------------------------------
3.  DATA MODEL & RLS (key fields)
------------------------------------------------------------
listings  
 id (uuid PK)  mls_number (unique)  list_price  status  address_line_1, city, state, latitude, longitude  builder_id  builders.id  new_construction (bool)  description  in_social_queue (bool) 

builders  
 id  name  specialties[]  price_range_min/max 

social_posts  
 id  user_id  title  description  status (draft/completed/posted)  content_type  format_type  post_url.

social_post_properties  
 id  social_post_id  property_id (listing)  image_complete  description_complete  contacted_complete  image_urls[]  description.

csv_uploads  
 metadata JSON: {duration_seconds, ignored_records, override_existing}.

user_field_mappings  
 user_id  target_table_name ('listings' | 'builders')  target_database_column  source_csv_header.

RLS highlights  
 user_settings / social_* / csv_uploads / user_field_mappings restricted to auth.uid().

------------------------------------------------------------
4.  DEVELOPER GUIDE
------------------------------------------------------------

4.1  Tech Stack  
 Next .js 14 App Router (pages in app/)  
 React 18 + shadcn/ui + Tailwind CSS + lucide icons.  
 Supabase JS v2.  
 Type-safe DB types at /types/supabase.ts (generated).  
 Recharts, Mapbox GL, PapaParse, Vercel AI SDK.

4.2  Env Vars  
NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL  
NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY  
SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY (Edge)  
NEXT_PUBLIC_MAPBOX_ACCESS_TOKEN (fallback map)  
(Secrets for CI).  

4.3  Migrations  
Supabase/migrations/*.sql  run with Supabase CLI or deploy to project.  
001-003 handle field-mapping table, mapbox key, renaming propertieslistings.  

4.4  Edge Function geocode-properties  
 POST /functions/v1/geocode-properties  
 Auth header required (session).  
 Processes batches of 10 listings lacking coordinates; respects DELAY_BETWEEN_REQUESTS_MS 200 ms.

4.5  Local dev  
pnpm i / npm i  
cp .env.example .env.local (fill keys)  
npm run dev  
Supabase: supabase start (or remote project).  
Edge function: supabase functions serve geocode-properties --env-file .env.local

------------------------------------------------------------
5.  MAINTENANCE & FAQ
------------------------------------------------------------
 Create Post button did nothing usually means required dialog fields empty or no listings selected  check toast error.  
 Map shows no dots  confirm Mapbox token saved & listings have lat/lng; run geocode batch.  
 Import stalls  inspect browser console & Supabase logs; large files may hit 10 MB limit.

------------------------------------------------------------
6.  ROAD-MAP / OPEN QUESTIONS 
------------------------------------------------------------
 Duplicate Prevention  currently dedupe key is mls_number; should we also dedupe by address if MLS blank?  
 Listings table cleanup  migration removed many columns; verify all code paths no longer reference them.  
 Map style  minimal grey/white is inline; consider hosting custom Mapbox style.  
 User roles  only authenticated now; need admin?  
 AI token cost guardrails  add token limit?  
 csv_uploads.metadata.ignored_records sometimes null  compute if overrideExisting=false?  
 Analytics queries may hit row-level limit; consider RPC view for large datasets.

====================================================================
